abstract.p: Monmouth University campus in West Long Branch, NJ, will play host to university's third annual Cajun Dance Festival on May 20 (S)

block.p: Speaking of zydeco, its unmistakable sound and the smell of spicy shrimp and crayfish will permeate Monmouth University campus in West Long Branch on May 20 as the university plays host to its third annual Cajun Dance Festival.
Starting at noon on the porch of Wilson Hall, the festival will last until dusk and will feature food, beverages and activities drawn from the traditions of southern Louisiana.

Speaking of zydeco, its unmistakable sound and the smell of spicy shrimp and crayfish will permeate Monmouth University campus in West Long Branch on May 20 as the university plays host to its third annual Cajun Dance Festival.
Starting at noon on the porch of Wilson Hall, the festival will last until dusk and will feature food, beverages and activities drawn from the traditions of southern Louisiana.

Laura Selikson of Zydeco Express will give Cajun two-step and waltz lessons. Music from French-influenced Cajun tunes to zydeco, which is derived from the Creole culture, will be provided by Geno Delafose and French Rockin' Boogie, the Marc Savoy Trio and the Magnolia Sisters. Cajun two-step and waltz is similar to the same country western dances, but usually simpler, and easier to learn, with fewer elaborate turns, Ms. Selikson said.
Tickets or information can be obtained by calling the university box office at (732) 571-3483.
